alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 3:00AM MST until December 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and patchy blowing snow above 4500 feet. Areas of snow showers increase in coverage this morning, becoming more widespread during the afternoon and evening. Snow may mix with rain at times below 4500-5000 feet and will be all rain below 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations generally ranging from 3 to 6 inches, with lesser amounts below 5000 feet and locally higher amounts above 6000 feet. Southwest winds gusting to near 35 mph at times, leading to areas of patchy blowing snow. * WHERE...Higher elevations of northern Gila County above 4500 feet. Including Payson and Pine-Strawberry. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could led to very difficult travel across the high terrain. Areas of patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. Hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Additional snow forecast through 11 PM this evening: Payson 4 to 6 inches Pine-Strawberry 5 to 9 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
